oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Mr. & Mrs. Amos T. Trentham of Gatlinburg, Tennessee, and their grandchildren, Peggy and Jay. Mrs. Trentham is weaving; Peggy is churning butter; Jay is whittling; and Mr. Trentham is playing the fiddle. All are on the stoop of a log cabin.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: RG 82: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Families; Children; Grandparents; Weaving; Butter making; Churns; Violins; Musicians; Wood carving; Log cabins
